availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Jefferson County, Kentucky, merchant. Kentucky native. Married Sarah C. Barbour Dickey in Christian County, Kentucky, on June 22, 1857. Father to Barbary Dickey and William Dickey. Merchant's clerk employed by Sandford Duncan Jr. in Caldwell County in 1850. Merchant in Louisville in 1860. Owned one enslaved person in Louisville in 1860. Merchant in partnership with Thomas J. Duncan and Sandford Duncan Jr. at Sandford Duncan & Co. in Louisville in 1861.
